seg.output: God the Lord has faithfully protected my church from the preachers, pious lords and trusted brethren in the Lord Jesus. But since St John's Day, when this happened to me, I have summoned all of them, men and women, and in the presence of my own servants I have admonished them, for the sake of God and in consideration of the mandate issued by our lords (which I have left to them) to desist from their purpose, which is: they go to the preachers' preaching, stand up at night from the children's beds, running hither and thither, do not go to us to preach, saying, our lords have nothing to do with them, they would like to leave their life and life as it is, that the preachers are right etc. I have also asked them that if they have any deficiency in teaching, they should come to me, I will talk to them kindly and they will talk to me, so that they will desist etc. They answered: Yes, as soon as they finish the harvest that is now on their necks, they will indicate the day to me and come to me etc. When the harvest was over, they asked me and showed me that if I was ready, I would take the report in front of the whole congregation.

God the Lord has faithfully protected my church from the pastors, pious Lord and loyal brother in the Lord Jesus. But since St. John's Day, when this happened to me, I have sent all of them, men and women, and in the presence of my people, out of reverence for God and in observance of the mandate issued by our Lord, to refrain from their undertaking, which is: attending the pastors' sermon, getting up in the night from the children's bed, running here and there, not going to our preaching, saying that our Lord had nothing to do with them, wishing to leave life and living to the merchants, that the pastors had the right, etc. Therefore, having also invited me, if there were any lack of teaching, they should come to me, and I would talk to them friendly and they with me, so that they would abstain, etc. To which they answered: Yes, as soon as they had finished the harvest that is now on their neck, they would indicate the day to me and come to me, etc. When the harvest was over, they offered and showed me that, if I wanted, they would be ready to conclude the matter with me in the presence of the whole community. Therefore, I, my pious brother, have taken it in gratitude, because I am pleased that they are willing to increase the sect and so boldly that they put the matter to me, so that I incur a greater displeasure, and I know, if I were to act with them openly according to their request, they already had it in their hearts, not to accept, but rather to aggravate.
Therefore, my pious Lord and brother, as I should behave towards them, I request your advice in writing. I may not come from the parish for fear of suspicion, so that I may consult you on matters concerning my office and other matters. Therefore, my pious Lord and brother, as I should behave towards them, I request your advice in writing. I must act as a loyal brother at all times, that I will do, as long as God grants me understanding and I will do my best and whatever I can think of in advice with you, that it may be the most Christian, to take it in hand with the people, that I will do. So that I may well recognize the people in the parish, the good will little protect, rest will not help. Therefore, my pious Lord and brother, as I should behave towards them, I request your advice in writing. I may not come from the parish for fear of suspicion, so that I may consult you on matters concerning my office and other matters. I must act as a loyal brother at all times, that I will do, as long as God grants me understanding and I will do my best and whatever I can think of in advice with you, that it may be the most Christian, to take it in hand with the people, that I will do. Then I have also indicated such a thing to the subordinate, at the same time also praying that he be concerned that also in Dachsen there were no officers appointed, although no answer has ever been given by the full and lazy administrator.
Wherewith, God the Lord is faithfully commended. Amen.
Dated Loven, 28 July.
Peter Frick, your willing brother in the Lord Jesus.
To my trusted dear Lord and brother, M. Heinrich Bullinger of Zurich.

God the Lord has faithfully protected my church from the tyrants, pious Lord and faithful brother in the Lord Jesus. But since St John's Day, as I was warned, I have sent all, men and women, and in the presence of my own people I have admonished them, for the sake of God and in respect of the mandate of our Lord issued (which I have shown them), for them to cease their former practices, which are: they go to the tyrants preaching, stand up late at night from the children's bed, running hither and thither, go not to us to preach, saying our Lord has nothing to do with them, they would like to leave their lives and live according to their own customs, that the tyrants are right, etc. Therefore they also asked me, if they had any deficiency in teaching, that they should come to me, and I would gladly and peacefully talk with them, so that they would abstain, etc. To which they replied: Yes, as soon as they have finished the harvest, which is now upon their necks, they will indicate a day to me and come to me, etc. When the harvest was over, they asked me and let me know, if I was ready, to take the report before the whole congregation with me. Therefore I, pious brother, have taken it in thanks, for I think that they willingly and so maliciously, that they would present me with the matter, so that I may receive much displeasure, and know where I may deal openly with them according to their suggestion, they already had in their heart to not accept, but to aggravate the accusation.
Therefore, pious Lord and brother, how I should conduct myself with them, I request written advice of you. Therefore I do not dare to come from the parish for fear of suspicion, that I may counsel with you about these and other matters concerning my office. Therefore, pious Lord and brother, how I should conduct myself with them, I request written advice of you. I will always act as a faithful brother, that I will also do, as God gives me understanding and light, and gladly do the best and what I can think of in advice with you, that would be the most Christian, to take it in hand with the people, that I will do. Therefore I know the people so well in the parish, that little good is protected, rest will not help. Therefore, pious Lord and brother, how I should conduct myself with them, I request written advice of you. I will always act as a faithful brother, that I will also do, as God gives me understanding and light, and gladly do the best and what I can think of in advice with you, that would be the most Christian, to take it in hand with the people, that I will do. Then I have also reported this to the subordinate for a long time, and also requested that he be aware, that to Dachsen also deputies should be appointed, since there have been no for a long time, but the full and slow bailiff has never given any answer.
Therefore they are faithfully recommended to God the Lord. Amen.
Dated Lauffen, 28 July.
Peter Frick, your willing brother in the Lord Jesus.
To my faithful beloved lord and brother, M. Heinrich Bullinger of Zurich.
